thread.title: The Secret Life Of Five Year Olds' Eva applauded online
thread.title_full: The Secret Life Of Five Year Olds' Eva applauded online

title: The Secret Life Of Five Year Olds' Eva applauded online
text: Share this article Share The two minute snippet from the show also sees five-year-old Jude challenged by Eva when he says girls can't be scientists. When Jude says that female scientists 'make silly potions' Eva hits back explaining she once 'extracted the DNA from a banana'. Eva, who appeared in the last episode of The Secret Life of Five Year Olds has been hailed as a feminist icon by viewers after her rousing speech on gender equality Eva explains to producers that it is essential for women to vote when they grow up before telling them 'boys aren't better than girls. They're exactly the same' When co-star Jude (pictured doing Karate with Eva) says that girls can't be scientists Eva points out that she once extracted the DNA of a banana Eva later reiterates her point of gender equality saying 'boys aren't better than girls. They're exactly the same' and then repeating 'They're exactly the same.' Channel 4' shared the clip on their Facebook page describing Eva as a 'feminist icon' less than 24 hours ago and has already amassed more than three million views. Fans of Eva have also taken to Twitter to applaud the young girl's forward thinking. Many users wanted to congratulate Eva's parents on their stellar job on bringing up their daughter. Several social media users suggested that Eva might have a potential as world leader. Others said that Eva's behaviour gave them hope for the future young women of the world. Share or comment on this article 459
